newsitem.title: ROMANIA: Bucharest bourse turnover rises, prices fall.
newsitem.headline: Bucharest bourse turnover rises, prices fall.

text.p: Strong buying in fertiliser maker Azomures SA took Bucharest stock exchange turnover up to 54 million lei from 42.1 million previously.
But thin demand for other stocks pushed most prices down, sending two independent indices to year lows, traders said.
Seven stocks touched new lows, three drifted higher, one stayed unchanged and five had no trade.

"Today's higher turnover level does not mean investors' interest has grown," said a trader. "There was one investor buying large share packages in Azomures, despite its rising price. Otherwise, interest was as thin as ever."
Azomures, which took 86 percent of turnover, opened at 11,100 lei, its closing price in the previous session, and rose to 11,500 by the end of trading.
Brokers said parliamentary approval on Wednesday for a new reformist government had little impact on the market.
"Perhaps it is to early to expect some enthusiasm from this market, which barely responds to anything," said a broker.

The new cabinet, a coalition grouping the centrist Democratic Convention, Social Democrats and representatives of ethnic Hungarians in Romania, has pledged to support the expansion of Romania's budding capital market.
It also says it will work out rules to encourage foreign portfolio investors, so far absent from the local market.
On Thursday, syringe maker Sanevit SA remained suspended for the eighth consecutive session pending an announcement on a recent shareholders' decision to add imported equipment to its capital base.

Two unofficial value-weighted indices - the VAB, computed by Vanguard SA, and Bucharest Investment Group 's BIG -- fell to year lows. The VAB dropped 2.9 percent to 273.4 points and the BIG slipped 2.86 percent a 272.6 points.
DEC 12 DEC 10 Week's change 1996 high 1996 low
